Room.Name: The Temple Of Mota
Room.Description: You are in the southern end of the temple hall in the Temple of Mota. The temple has been constructed from giant marble blocks, eternal in appearance, and most of the walls are covered by ancient wall paintings picturing gods, giants and peasants. Large steps lead down through the grand temple gate, descending the huge mound upon which the temple is built and ends on the temple square below. Equally large steps lead UP through a small door into the ENTRANCE to MUD SCHOOL. (type 'up' to go to MUD SCHOOL.) A small plaque is on this wall.

Exit.Description: At the northern end of the temple hall is a statue and a huge altar.
You see the temple square.

ExtraDescription.Description: This entire world has been integrated, modified, debugged, and enhanced by Hatchet, Kahn, and Furey of MERC Industries to be run by any MERC Mud. 1992 December 17 ROM enhancements by Alander.

Room.Name: Priest's Inner Sanctum
Room.Description: This is the inner sanctum. A picture of the mighty Mota is hanging on the wall, just above the altar which is set against the western wall. A well in the middle of the floor leads down into darkness. Vile smells waft from the depths.

Exit.Description: You see your favorite place, the bar of divination.

Room.Name: Priest's Bar
Room.Description: The bar is one of the finest in the land, lucky it is members only. Fine furniture is set all around the room. A small sign is hanging on the wall.

Exit.Description: You see the entrance.
You see the inner sanctum.

ExtraDescription.Description: The sign reads: Free instructions provided by the waiter: Buy - Buy something (drinkable) from the waiter. List - The waiter will show you all the different drinks and specialties, and tell the price of each.

Room.Name: Entrance to Priest's Guild
Room.Description: The entrance hall is a small modest room, reflecting the true nature of the Priests. The exit leads east to the temple square. A small entrance to the bar is in the northern wall.

Exit.Description: You see the bar, richly decorated with really stylish furniture.
You see the Temple Square.

Room.Name: The Temple Square
Room.Description: You are standing on the temple square. Huge marble steps lead up to the temple gate. The entrance to the Priests Guild is to the west, and the old Grunting Boar Inn, is to the east. Just south of here you see the market square, the center of Midgaard.

Exit.Description: You see the temple.
You see the good old Grunting Boar Inn.
You see the Market Square.
You see the entrance to the Priests Guild.
You see the air.

Room.Name: Entrance to the Grunting Boar Inn
Room.Description: You are standing in the entrance hall of the Grunting Boar Inn. The hall has been wisely decorated with simple but functional furniture. A small staircase leads up to the defunct reception room and the bar is to the east.

Exit.Description: Surprise! You see the bar.
You see the temple square.
You see the defunct reception room.

Room.Name: The Grunting Boar
Room.Description: You are standing in the bar. The bar is set against the northern wall, old archaic writing, carvings and symbols cover its top. A fireplace is built into the western wall, and through the southeastern windows you can see the temple square. This place makes you feel like home. A small sign with big letters is fastened to the bar.

Exit.Description: You see the exit to the entrance hall.

ExtraDescription.Description: Although it is very hard to understand, you think it looks a lot like beer, poems about beer, and small beer-mugs.

The sign reads: Free instructions provided by the Grunting Boar Inn. Buy - Buy something (drinkable) from the bartender. List - The bartender will show you all the different drinks and specialties, and tell the price of each.

Room.Name: The Defunct Reception
Room.Description: You are standing in a dusty, defunct reception. The staircase leads down to the entrance hall.

Exit.Description: You see the entrance hall.

Room.Name: The Bakery
Room.Description: You are standing inside the small bakery. A sweet scent of Danish and fine bread fills the room. The bread and Danish are arranged in fine order on the shelves, and seem to be of the finest quality. A small sign is on the counter.

Exit.Description: You see the main street.

ExtraDescription.Description: Free instructions provided by the store: Buy - Will buy you some bread or pastry. List - The baker will kindly tell you the price and sort of the bread in his bakery.

You see that this is truly delicious pastry. Must be made by a Dane from Denmark (which surely is not the capital of Sweden!). Former ruler of Scandinavia, England, Northern Germany, Northern France, Russia, Greenland, Iceland, Estonia etc. etc. The sight of those large, wholesome chokoladeboller makes your mouth water and your soul sing.

Room.Name: The General Store
Room.Description: You are inside the general store. All sorts of items are stacked on shelves behind the counter, safely out of your reach. A small note hangs on the wall.

Exit.Description: You see the main street.

ExtraDescription.Description: The note reads: List - Show which various items are in the store. Buy - Buy an item. Value - The shopkeeper will (free of charge) tell how much he will pay for your item. Sell - Sell an item.

Room.Name: The Weapon Shop
Room.Description: You are inside the weapon shop. There is a small note on the counter.

Exit.Description: You see the main street.

ExtraDescription.Description: The note reads: List - Show which various items are in the store. Buy - Buy an item. Value - The shopkeeper will (free of charge) tell how much he will pay for your item. Sell - Sell an item.

Room.Name: Main Street
Room.Description: You are at the end of the main street of Midgaard. South of here is the entrance to the Guild of Magic Users. The street continues east towards the market square. The magic shop is to the north and to the west is the city gate.

Exit.Description: You see the magic shop.
You see the main street.
You see the entrance to the Guild of Magic Users.
You see the city gate.

Room.Name: Main Street
Room.Description: You are on the main street passing through the City of Midgaard. South of here is the entrance to the Armoury, and the bakery is to the north. East of here is the market square.

Exit.Description: You see the bakery.
You see the market square.
You see the armoury.
You see the main street.

Room.Name: Market Square
Room.Description: You are standing on the market square, the famous Square of Midgaard. A large, peculiar looking statue is standing in the middle of the square. Roads lead in every direction, north to the temple square, south to the common square, east and westbound is the main street.

Exit.Description: You see the temple square.
You see the main street.
You see the common square.
You see the main street.

ExtraDescription.Description: What you see is the Midgaard Worm, stretching around the Palace of Midgaard.

Room.Name: The Main Street
Room.Description: You are on Main Street crossing through town. To the north is the general store, and the main street continues east. To the west you see and hear the market place and to the south is the Jeweller's Shop.

Exit.Description: You see the general store.
You see Main Street.
You see the Jeweller's Shop.
You see the market square.

Room.Name: The Main Street
Room.Description: The main street, to the north is the weapon shop and to the south is the Guild of Swordsmen. To the east you leave town and to the west the street leads to the market square.

Exit.Description: You see the weapon shop.
You see the city gate.
You see the swordsmen's guild.
You see the main street leading to the market square.

Room.Name: Entrance to Mage's Guild
Room.Description: The entrance hall is a small, poor lighted room.

Exit.Description: You see the main street.
You see your favorite place, the Mage's Bar.

Room.Name: Mage's Bar
Room.Description: The bar is one of the wierdest in the land. Mystical images float around the air. Illusions of fine furniture appear all around the room.

Exit.Description: You see the lobby.
You see the laboratory.

Room.Name: Mage's Laboratory
Room.Description: This is the Magical Experiments Laboratory. Dark smoke-stained stones arch over numerous huge oaken tables, most of these cluttered with strange- looking pipes and flasks. The floor is covered with half-erased pentagrams and even weirder symbols, and a blackboard in a dark corner has only been partially cleaned, some painful-looking letters faintly visible. A well in the middle of the floor leads down into darkness. Vile smells waft from the depths.

Exit.Description: You see the bar.

Room.Name: The Armoury
Room.Description: The armoury with all kinds of armours on the walls and in the window. You see helmets, shields and chain mails. To the north is the main street. On the wall is a small note.

Exit.Description: You see the main street.

ExtraDescription.Description: You can use these commands for trading: value <item> To get the price of an item in your possession. sell <item> To sell something. buy <item> To buy something (provided that the shop has it in store). list Gives you a listing of the shop's inventory. WE DON'T GIVE CREDIT; WE DON'T EXPECT TO RECEIVE CREDIT! NO HAGGLING

Room.Name: Entrance Hall to the Guild of Swordsmen
Room.Description: The entrance hall to the Guild of Swordsmen. A place where one has to be careful not to say something wrong (or right). To the east is the bar and to the north is the main street.

Exit.Description: You see the main street.
You see the swordsmen's bar, many noises comes from there.

Room.Name: The Bar of Swordsmen
Room.Description: The bar of swordsmen, once upon a time beautifully furnished. But now the furniture is all around you in small pieces. To the south is the yard, and to the west is the entrance hall.

Exit.Description: You see the practice yard.
You see the entrance hall to the thieves guild.

Room.Name: The Tournament and Practice Yard
Room.Description: The practice yard of the fighters. To the north is the bar. A well leads down into darkness.

Exit.Description: You see the bar.

Room.Name: Eastern End of Poor Alley
Room.Description: You are at the poor alley. South of here is the Grubby Inn and to the east you see common square. Melancholy's map shop is north. The alley continues further west.

Exit.Description: You see Melancholy's Map Shop
You see the common square.
You see the Inn.
You see the poor alley.

Room.Name: The Common Square
Room.Description: The common square, people pass you, talking to each other. To the west is the poor alley and to the east is the dark alley. To the north, this square is connected to the market square. From the south you notice a nasty smell.

Exit.Description: You see the market square.
You see the dark alley.
You see the city dump.
You see the poor alley.

Room.Name: The Dark Alley
Room.Description: The dark alley, to the west is the common square and to the south is the Guild of Thieves. Grebe's Tavern, the famous sailor's dive, is north. The alley continues east.

Exit.Description: You see a foul-smelling sailor's dive.
The alley continues east.
You see the entrance to the thieves guild.
You see the common square.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is the thieves guild, don't enter if you care about your health or money.

Room.Name: Entrance Hall to the Guild of Thieves
Room.Description: The entrance hall to the thieves' and assassins' guild. A place where you can lose both your life and your money, if you are not careful. To the north is the dark alley and to the east is the thieves' bar.

Exit.Description: You see the alley.
You see the thieves bar, where everything disappears.

Room.Name: The Thieves Bar
Room.Description: The bar of the thieves. Once upon a time this place was beautifully furnished, but now it seems almost empty. To the south is the yard, and to the west is the entrance hall. (Maybe the furniture has been stolen?!)

Exit.Description: You see the secret yard.
You see the entrance hall to the thieves guild.

ExtraDescription.Description: As you look at the furniture, the chair you sit on disappears.

Room.Name: The Secret Yard
Room.Description: The secret practice yard of thieves and assassins. To the north is the bar. A well leads down into darkness.

Exit.Description: You see the bar.

Room.Name: The Dump
Room.Description: The dump, where the people from the city drop their garbage. Through the garbage you can see a large junction of pipes, looks like the entrance to the sewer system. South of here you see the river and to the north is the common square. A rickety old bridge leads south to the promenade.

Exit.Description: You see the common square.
You see a river between northern and southern Midgaard. A small bridge spans the flow.

Room.Name: The Pet Shop
Room.Description: The Pet Shop is a small crowded store, full of cages and animals of various sorts and sizes. There is a sign on the wall.

Exit.Description: You see the Alley.

ExtraDescription.Description: The sign reads: Use 'List' to see the available pets. Use 'Buy <pet> <name>' to buy yourself a pet and name it. You can use 'order <pet> <instructions>' to order your pets around. If you abuse your pet, it will no longer regard you as its master. If you have several pets you may use 'order all <instructions>' Regards, The Shopkeeper

Room.Name: Pet Shop Store
Room.Description: This is the small dark room in which the Pet Shop Boy keeps his pets. It is vital that this room be immediately after the pet shop.

Room.Name: The Magic Shop
Room.Description: You are in a small room that smells of rare chemicals and spices. Dividing the room in two is a large desk, and on the wall behind it are numerous shelves crammed with jars, bottles, books and scrolls of all sorts and sizes.

Exit.Description: You see the main street.

ExtraDescription.Description: Each scroll is stored in a leather tube that protects it from moist.
Most of them appear to be very old and dusty.
Some of them are transparent enabling you to see that some contain colored powders while others contain body parts of various animals.

Room.Name: The Jeweller's Shop
Room.Description: You are in a small, beautifully furnished room. The warm light emanating from the small oil lamps on the walls is reflected in the hard, polished surface of the big mahogany desk that stands in the centre of the room. A small sign with golden letters stands on the desk.

Exit.Description: You see Main Street.

ExtraDescription.Description: The golden letters say :- Use 'list' to see what is in store, 'buy <item>' to buy an item, 'sell <item>' to sell an item and 'value <item>' to make the jeweller evaluate an item.
Your face is reflected in its surface.
They are made from polished gold and looks as if they are securely fastened to the smooth stone walls.

Room.Name: The Leather Shop
Room.Description: An acrid smell fills this large room. Along the walls are numerous shelves containing all sorts of animal hide and in the crackling fireplace hangs a big iron pot with boiling water. In the middle of the room is a large oak table. A wooden sign is hanging above the fireplace.

Exit.Description: You see the alley.

ExtraDescription.Description: The wooden sign says :- Use 'list' to see what is in store, 'buy <item>' to buy an item, 'sell <item>' to sell an item and 'value <item>' to make the leather worker evaluate an item.
Several large pieces of leather hide are boiling in the iron pot.
It is made from solid oak but appears to be very used. Its surface is covered in marks and scratches. A large burning candle stands directly on the table surface, tallow flowing down its sides.
It is a rather large fireplace made from heavy granite rocks.

Room.Name: Inside the West Gate of Midgaard
Room.Description: You are by two small towers that have been built into the city wall and connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate. Main Street leads east and Wall Road leads both north and south from here.

Exit.Description: Wall road runs along the inner city wall to the north.
You see Main Street.
You see the road running along the inner side of the city wall. You notice that it is called Wall Road.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with some kind of mortar. It is far too high to climb.
Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.
It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood. They have been reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy. One of the doors is equipped with a very big lock.
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it from one tower to the other.

Room.Name: Inside the East Gate of Midgaard
Room.Description: You are by two small towers that have been built into the city wall and connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate. Main Street leads west from here. Wall road crosses the street, heading north and south along the city wall.

Exit.Description: Wall road heads north along the city wall.
You see the city gate.
Wall road heads south towards the poor section of town.
You see Main Street.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with some kind of mortar. It is far too high to climb.
Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.
It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood. They have been reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy. One of the doors is equipped with a very big lock.
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it from one tower to the other.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are walking next to the western city wall. The road continues further south and the city gate is just north of here.

Exit.Description: You see the city gate.
The road continues further south.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with some kind of mortar. It is far too high to climb.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are walking next to the western city wall. Wall Road continues further north and south. A small, poor alley leads east. Some letters have been written on the wall here.

Exit.Description: The road continues further north.
The alley leads east.
The road continues further south.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with some kind of mortar. It is far too high to climb.
It says 'Who watches the watchmen?'

Room.Name: Poor Alley
Room.Description: You are in narrow and dirty alley leading east and west. The leather shop is to the north.

Exit.Description: The leather shop is to the north.
The alley leads east.
There is an ornate doorway to the south.
The alley leads west.

Room.Name: Alley at Levee
Room.Description: You are standing in the alley which continues east and west. South of here you see the levee. North is the Pet Shop.

Exit.Description: You see, hear, and smell the pet shop.
The alley leads east.
You see the levee.
The alley leads west.

Room.Name: Eastern end of Alley
Room.Description: You are standing at the eastern end of the alley, near the city walls. Wall road loops around the city to your east, and you can see an old three-story warehouse to the south. The Fountain of Youth Apothecary is north.

Exit.Description: You see a pricey-looking potion shop.
You see wall road, running a north-south loop around the city.
You see the warehouse.
You see the alley.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are standing on the road next to the western city wall which continues north. South of here is a bridge across the river. To the east, you see an odd looking building painted bright orange with purple trim... it must be the Mob Factory!

Exit.Description: You see the road.
You see the bridge.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with some kind of mortar. It is far too high to climb.

Room.Name: Grubby Inn
Room.Description: You are inside the old Grubby Inn. This place has not been cleaned for several decades, vile smells make you dizzy.

Exit.Description: You see the alley.

Room.Name: Levee
Room.Description: You are at the levee. South of here you see the river gently flowing west. The river bank is very low making it possible to enter the river. Directly across the river you can see a small boat landing built off of Kate's Diner.

Exit.Description: You see the Alley.
You see the river flowing west.

Room.Name: Abandoned Warehouse
Room.Description: You are inside the only room in the old warehouse. The place is very dusty and appears to have been unused for many years. The skylight spills violet-tinged light.

Exit.Description: You see the alley.
You see machine dreams and taste violet phosphor.

Room.Name: On the Bridge
Room.Description: You are standing on the stone bridge crosses the river. The bridge is built out from the western city wall and the river flows west through an opening in the wall ten feet below the bridge.

Exit.Description: You see the road.
You see the Concourse.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with some kind of mortar. It is far too high to climb.
You cannot really see it from here as it is somewhere beneath your feet.
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with some kind of mortar, just like the wall.

Room.Name: Outside the West Gate of Midgaard
Room.Description: You are by two small towers that have been built into the city wall and connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate. To the west you can see the edge of a big forest. A small dusty trail leads north along the wall.

Exit.Description: The city gate is to the east.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with some kind of mortar. It is far too high to climb.
Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.
It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood. They have been reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy. One of the doors is equipped with a very big lock.
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it from one tower to the other.

Room.Name: Outside the East Gate of Midgaard
Room.Description: You are by two small towers that have been built into the city wall and connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate. To the east the plains stretch out in the distance. To the north a small dusty trail follow the city wall.

Exit.Description: You see the city gate.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with some kind of mortar. It is far too high to climb.
Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.
It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood. They have been reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy. One of the doors is equipped with a very big lock.
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it from one tower to the other.

Room.Name: By the Temple Altar
Room.Description: You are by the temple altar in the northern end of the Temple of Mota. A huge altar made from white polished marble is standing in front of you and behind it is a ten foot tall sitting statue of Odin, the King of the Gods. The back of the altar opens into a a beautiful atrium, above which can be seen a rainbow.

Exit.Description: You see the southern end of the temple.

ExtraDescription.Description: The statue represents the Great God Zed, holding a staff. He has long, grey hair and beard and a kindly look on his face. His staff is topped by a painted cube, the 6 faces of which represent the 6 aspects of his power.
Even though the altar is more than ten feet long it appears to be made from a single block of white virgin marble.

Room.Name: Newbie Creators Room
Room.Description: Within this room vats of fluid like substances line the walls. Hundreds of there vats are filled with little nofaced creatures. A small man wanders about the vats pulling levers and chanting spells to form each one into a full fledged NEWBIE.

Room.Name: The Fountain of Youth Apothecary
Room.Description: An old man putters around behind the counter, making strange love potions and curative philtres. He turns as you enter, and looks on with avarice. Judging from the furnishings, he's been made very wealthy by his trade.

Exit.Description: You see the eastern end of alley.

Room.Name: In the air...
Room.Description: WOW you can fly! You are floating in the air above Temple Square of Midgaard.

Exit.Description: Back down on the earth where you should be!

Room.Name: First Room To The Begining Of Your New Life
Room.Description: Welcome to the fray of Battle. This is the First step to the rest of your Life. KBK is a Player Kill Mud so have fun.

Room.Name: Training Room
Room.Description: The first thing you seem to notice as you walk into the room is that there are many odd looking objects on the walls. In the center of the room on the floor is a huge red and black rug, made of the skin of an bear. The room seems to be lined in gold tremmings, the walls made from redwood. The room smells of sweat and blood. The celing seems to be made of a buch of strong looking hay, layed over each other in several thick layers. On the western side of the wall, hangs a sign that reads "training room".

Room.Name: Practice Room
Room.Description: As you enther the room of learning, you take in your surroundings. On the wall you notice an picture of a great guildmaster. Along the sides of the wall are rows of old practice dummies and many old petrufide books of learning that cannot be opend. This room seems to be made of wood and lined in a golden border. In the middle of the floor lays a big red, velvet rug with many arcane runes on it. The runes are that of an wise old man who was the teacher of everything that there is to know about battle and defense. On the eastern side of the wall hangs a sign, it reads "practice room".

Room.Name: The Room Of Passage
Room.Description: You have walked into the room of passage. The being in the center of the room is here to give you brief guidance, to tell you where you need to go. On the floor lays a big red velvet rug, with fringed ends. The room is made from wood, lined with a golden trim. There seems to be no celing in this room, it seems to be open to the elements of the world. The floor around the rug seems to be made of black dull marble. It looks as if it has been recently build and never walked upon by a soul.

Room.Name: Northwest end of Concourse
Room.Description: You are at the concourse, the city wall is just west. A small promenade goes east, and the bridge is just north of here. The concourse continues south along the city wall.

Exit.Description: You see the Bridge.
You see the promenade.
The concourse continues south.

Room.Name: Promenade
Room.Description: The river gently flows west just north of here. The promenade continues further east and to the west you see the city wall. Park Road leads south from here.

Exit.Description: The promenade.
Park Road leads south.
You see the Concourse.

Room.Name: Promenade
Room.Description: The river gently flows west just north of here. The promenade continues both east and west. A rickety bridge crosses the river to the north, towards the city dump (fortunately, the wind is blowing towards the dump today). South of here you see the entrance to the park, and a small building seems to be just west of the entrance. Austral Square, home of Kate's Diner, lies to your east.

Exit.Description: A rickety old bridge crosses the river, heading towards the city dump.
You see people moving in and out of Kate's Diner.
You see the park entrance.
You see the promenade.

Room.Name: Austral Square
Room.Description: The Promenade opens here onto Austral Square, on the south bank of the Midgaard River. All around you is the bustle of Southern Midgaard-- shopkeepers on break, a town gossip or two prattling away. You hear the river lapping at the pilings of the dock by Kate's Diner, which is to your north. Emerald Avenue begins to the south, the Promenade continues west, and the concourse ends to your east.

Exit.Description: You smell the heavenly scents of Kate's Diner.
You see the Concourse.
The small path leads south.
You see the promenade.

Room.Name: Northeast end of Concourse
Room.Description: You are at the Concourse. The city wall is just east and Austral Square, home of Kate's Diner, is west. Looking across the river you see an old warehouse. A strong stone bridge crosses the river to the north, where the concourse becomes wall road. The Concourse continues south along the wall.

Exit.Description: A strong stone bridge crosses the river.
The Concourse continues south, towards an intersection with Penny Lane.
You Austral Square.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with some kind of mortar. It is far too high to climb.

Room.Name: Park Entrance
Room.Description: You are standing just inside the small park of Midgaard. To the north is the promenade and a small path leads south into the park. To your east is the famous Park Cafe.

Exit.Description: You see the promenade.
You see Park Cafe.
You see the park.

Room.Name: Park Cafe
Room.Description: You are inside Park Cafe, a very well lighted, cosy place. The cafe is built from large logs. Through the windows in the northern wall you see the river, and through the southern window you see many vigorous colorful plants.

Exit.Description: You see the park entrance.

Room.Name: Small path through the park
Room.Description: You are walking along a small path through the park. The path continues south and east.

Room.Name: Small path in the park
Room.Description: You are standing on a small path inside the park. The park entrance is just north of here, and Park Cafe is just east of the entrance. The path leads further east and west.

Exit.Description: You see the northern park entrance.

Room.Name: Small path in the park
Room.Description: You are on a small path running through the park. It continues west and south and just north of here you see the southern wall of Park Cafe.

Room.Name: Cityguard Head Quarters
Room.Description: You are inside a tidy office. A big desk made from dark wood is standing in the centre of the room.

Exit.Description: You see Park Road.
You see a sign saying 'KEEP OUT'.

Room.Name: Park Road
Room.Description: The road continues north and south. A building is just west of here, you notice a sign on the door. The park entrance is to the east.

Exit.Description: You see the park entrance.
You see the cityguard head quarters.

ExtraDescription.Description: The sign on the door says:- Cityguard Head Quarters

Room.Name: Western Park Entrance
Room.Description: You are standing at the western end of the park. A small path leads east into the park and going west through the entrance you will reach Park Road.

Room.Name: A path in the park
Room.Description: You are in the park. The paths lead north and west. Westwards is the park entrance and to the east you see a small pond.

Exit.Description: You see the pond.
You see the western park entrance.

Room.Name: The Pond
Room.Description: You are swimming around in the pond, feeling rather stupid. You can get back on the path from the eastern and western end of the pond.

Room.Name: A path in the park
Room.Description: You are in the park. The paths lead north and east. Eastwards is the park entrance and to the west you see a small pond.

Room.Name: Eastern Park Entrance
Room.Description: You are standing at the eastern end of the park. A small path leads west into the park. Going east through the entrance you will reach Emerald Avenue.

Room.Name: Emerald Avenue
Room.Description: You are at Emerald Avenue which continues north and south. To the west is the park entrance and to the east is the not very big Town Hall of Midgaard.

Room.Name: Park Road
Room.Description: You are on Park Road which leads north and south.

Room.Name: Emerald Avenue
Room.Description: You are standing at a bend on Emerald Avenue. The road leads north and west. To the east, you see some run-down slums...it looks like the bad part of town.

Room.Name: Road Crossing
Room.Description: You are in the middle of the road cross. Roads lead in all directions. A huge black iron chain as thick as a tree trunk is fastened into the ground at the centre of the road cross. Its other end leads directly upwards towards the sky. A road sign is here.

ExtraDescription.Description: The the chain reaches the clouds high above you. It must take some really powerful magic to hold such a chain in place.
The sign points in all directions: North - Emerald Avenue. East - Park Road. South - Emerald Avenue. West - Park Road. Someone has added the following with red paint: Up - Redferne's Flying Citadel.

Room.Name: Emerald Avenue
Room.Description: You are standing at a bend on Emerald Avenue. The road leads south and east.

Room.Name: Park Road
Room.Description: You are on Park Road which leads south and north. Elm Street is east of here.

Room.Name: Elm Street
Room.Description: You are on Elm street. Park Road is to the west and Elm Street continues in eastward direction.

Room.Name: Elm Street
Room.Description: You near the end of Elm Street. An old elm tree grows here. A heavy iron grating is south, surrounding the city's graveyard. You can see a sign hanging on the grate. The concourse joins Elm Street to the east, and the street ends to the north near a run-down neighborhood.

Exit.Description: You see the beginnings of Midgaard's bad neighborhoods.
You see the concourse.
Through the solid iron bars you see the graveyard.

ExtraDescription.Description: The fresh young leaves of the elm tree wave gently in the wind.
The sign says :- Graveyard of Midgaard Many brave adventurers have found their final resting place here. Please show respect and do not desecrate their tombs.
Looks heavy. A small sign is hanging on it.

Room.Name: Emerald Avenue
Room.Description: You are on Emerald Avenue which continues north. The Concourse is south of here.

Room.Name: Park Road
Room.Description: You are on Park Road which continues north. The Concourse is south of here.

Room.Name: On the Concourse
Room.Description: You are at the southwest corner of the city wall. The Concourse leads both north and east.

Room.Name: On the Concourse
Room.Description: You are walking around the scenic concourse as it continues its path around the city of Midgaard. The south gate of the city lies to your east, and the southwestern corner of the city wall is west. Emerald Avenue stretches out to the north.

Exit.Description: Emerald avenue lies to the north.
You can see the heavily guarded southern gate of Midgaard.

Room.Name: On the Concourse
Room.Description: The concourse continues its path around the city. The southern gates of the city are west of here, and park road lies north. The northeastern corner of the city wall is east.

Exit.Description: You see the south gate of Midgaard.

Room.Name: On the Concourse
Room.Description: You are at the southeast corner of the city wall. The Concourse leads both north and west.

Room.Name: Park Road
Room.Description: You are at Park Road which continues north and south.

Room.Name: Emerald Avenue
Room.Description: You are standing on the north end of Emerald Avenue. To the north is Austral Square and Kate's Diner, to the east is the small street Penny Lane.

Room.Name: Emerald Avenue
Room.Description: You are standing at a bend on Emerald Avenue. To the east the road goes on and to the south is the Road Crossing.

Room.Name: Emerald Avenue
Room.Description: You are standing at a bend on Emerald Avenue. To the west the road goes on and to the north is the Road Crossing.

Room.Name: Park Road
Room.Description: You are at a bend on Park Road. To the north the road goes on and to the east is the Road Crossing. To the south, the ancient cliffs rise from deep under the ground, forming a wall.

Room.Name: Park Road
Room.Description: You are at a bend on Park Road. To the south the road goes on and to the west is the Road Crossing.

Room.Name: The Waiting Room
Room.Description: You are standing in the waiting room at the town hall. Wooden chairs stand along the walls and a long desk is placed in the middle of the room.

Exit.Description: It looks like some kind of office.
The exit west leads to Emerald Avenue.

Room.Name: The Mayor's Office
Room.Description: You are in the not very big office of the Mayor of Midgaard. A large and polished but completely empty desk is standing in front of an armchair that looks so comfortable that it most of all resembles a bed with the head end raised slightly.

Exit.Description: The waiting room is to the west.

ExtraDescription.Description: This chair is really a masterpiece. A chair where one can sit as comfortably as in a bed. All lecture halls should be equipped with these things.

Room.Name: Penny Lane
Room.Description: You are on Penny Lane. Emerald Avenue is to the west and Penny Lane continues in eastward direction.

Room.Name: Penny Lane
Room.Description: You are on Penny Lane. The narrow road continues north and west, and the concourse intersects this street to the east.

Exit.Description: You see the concourse.

Room.Name: The end of Penny Lane
Room.Description: You are at the end of Penny Lane. The only exit appears to be south.

Room.Name: Captain's Office
Room.Description: You are in the Office of the Captain of the Guard. The Midgaard Coat of Arms is hanging on the north wall and a heavy steel door is to the south.

Exit.Description: You see the Cityguard Head Quarters.
You see the heavy steel door.

ExtraDescription.Description: Although a bit dusty the Coat of Arms is an excellent piece of work.

Room.Name: The Jail
Room.Description: You are in a dark and humid jail. The dark stone walls are hard and cold to the touch. A heavy steel door is to the north.

Exit.Description: You see the heavy steel door.

ExtraDescription.Description: The walls are marked with lots of scratches. Some of them spell sentences like "JAIL IS BETTER THAN SQL" and "BIGFOOTDAMOOSE IS ALIVE".

Room.Name: The end of Elm Street
Room.Description: Elm street ends here, next to a dangerous-looking run down neighborhood. You can enter the slums to the east, or head towards the graveyard to the south. It occurs to you that this isn't the happiest section of town.

Exit.Description: Elm street continues towards a graveyard.

Room.Name: Kate's Diner
Room.Description: The smells of baking bread and simmering stew lead you dancing through the doorway of the diner. No greasy spoons to be seen here-- the booth walls are covered in casual paisleys; the chairs are carved wood, rescued from garage sales. Most tables have chess or backgammon boards carved and painted on their fingertip-smooth tops. The refrain of some musical or other from the 1930's blends with the dusty golden light and the wonderful smells to put you completely at ease. A huge picture window looks out over the Midgaard River, and a doorway leads north onto the dock and the South Bank river landing, while the main entrance to the south returns you to Austral Square. On most days you will find Kate here, testing a batch of stew or brewing a special pot of cinnamon coffee, eerily just in time for your arrival Pull up a chair, perhaps play a game, and take time out to talk.

Exit.Description: A small boat landing lets boats land at the diner.
You see Austral Square.

ExtraDescription.Description: You can see a rickety bridge to your northwest, leading back into Central Midgaard. A rustic dock connects the Diner with the Midgaard River, and a boat or two floats lazily past. Across the river you can see the Levee and the Guild of Thieves, but they seem very far away from all of this...

Room.Name: Melancholy's Maps
Room.Description: As you walk in, a sudden gust of wind enters the shop and sends several scraps of paper fly around the room. You blink as the dust you've stirred up stings your eyes, and take a look around the shop. This shop is cluttered with old pieces of parchment, stacks of books, and odd scraps. A desk with slightly less clutter than the rest of the shop is in front of you. A scroll case full of scrolls is behind the desk. A bookcase is to the right of you, and to the left is a window overlooking the Common Square. A small door, half hidden by a stack of books, leads to a room in the back of the shop.

Exit.Description: A sign on the door says, "Unauthorized Personel Prohibited".
To the south is the Poor Alley. Across the alley, you see the Grubby Inn.

ExtraDescription.Description: You peer out the window and see a cityguard beating up an old lady.
You see many cartographer journals and topographical studies. You also see quite a few tomes written by someone named "Anson MacDonald".

Room.Name: Melancholy's Room
Room.Description: A faint smell of incense teases your nose as you enter this room. You step onto a soft bearskin rug and look around. A simple bed lies against the far wall. At the foot of it is a sturdy, ironbound chest, most likely full of Melancholy's trappings from her adventuring days. On a small table under a window to the east is a vase with a single white rose. Other than that, the room is quite bare.

Exit.Description: A small door to the south leads out into the map shop.

ExtraDescription.Description: This chest is firmly locked, and the device by which it opens is beyond your reckoning.

Room.Name: Temple Of Stupid
Room.Description: As you enter the abandoned warehouse your eyes blink violently to adjust to the almost total darkness. You wonder where the windows are as you step into a mud puddle in the middle of the floor. As your eyes adjust, you realize that there are mud puddles all around the room, and this is some weird version of windows. In a flash of revelation, you realize that you've entered the Temple of Stupid.

Exit.Description: Poor Alley is to the north.

ExtraDescription.Description: The puddles on the floor are filthy and exude a foul stench.

Room.Name: Under the Bridge
Room.Description: The arch under the bridge is covered by seaweed for one foot above the surface of the river. The water gently flows through an opening in the lower part of the city wall.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with some kind of mortar. Looks pretty solid.

Room.Name: On the River
Room.Description: North of here you see the miserable buildings of the poor alley. The river flows west towards the bridge. The riverbanks are too steep to climb.

Room.Name: On the River
Room.Description: North of here you see the dump. The river flows from east to west. The riverbanks are too steep to climb. A bridge passes overhead, connecting the dump to the promenade.

Room.Name: On the River
Room.Description: The levee is directly north of here, and a small boat landing for Kate's Diner is to the south. The river flows in an east west direction.

Exit.Description: You see the landing in the back of Kate's Diner.

Room.Name: On the River
Room.Description: You see the warehouse on the northern riverbank. East of here the river passes under the eastern bridge and through the city wall. The banks of the levee are west, in the direction of the current.

Room.Name: On the River
Room.Description: The river enters from a hole in the eastern city wall. The hole has been blocked by several vertically positioned iron bars set into the wall. Overhead you can see the stone buttresses of the eastern bridge.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: Wall road extends north and south along the eastern walls of the city. The east gate is north of you, south is an intersection with a dark alley. You check to make sure you still have your wallet.

Exit.Description: The eastern gate of the city is north.
You see an intersection with a dark alley.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are walking along the eastern wall of the city, on a road extending between the east gate and a bridge to the south. A dark, dirty alley lies west of here. You step carefully around a pool of liquid...who knows what it could be in a place this foul...

Exit.Description: Wall road continues to the north, heading towards the gate.
Wall road continues to the south, towards a bridge over the Midgaard river.
A dirty, unlight alley lies to the west...it looks like a perfect spot for a mugging.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: The walls of Midgaard tower above you to the east, keeping the city safe from its enemies...you hope. An intersection with a dark alley lies north, and a bridge over the Midgaard river is south. Beyond the bridge wall road turns in the concourse.

Exit.Description: You see an intersection with a dark alley.
The eastern bridge crosses the river to the south.

Room.Name: On the Bridge
Room.Description: You are crossing a strong stone bridge, which spans the Midgaard river. Below you, the river flows into an opening in the city wall, sealed with strong metal bars. North of you is wall road, south of here the concourse loops around the inside of the city walls.

Exit.Description: Wall road continues to the north.
The concourse stretches around the southern parts of Midgaard.

ExtraDescription.Description: Hmm...some of the bars have been ripped out of the wall. Enough to pass a good sized raft or canoe, or perhaps even a barge. You wonder what sort of beast had the strength to do this.

Room.Name: The South Bridge
Room.Description: You are standing on a small, rickety bridge leading from the Midgaard City Dump to the much more attractive promenade of the southern parts of Midgaard. You can smell the stench of the dump to the north, the fresher air of the promenade seems preferable. Below you are the swift-moving currents of the Midgaard river.

Exit.Description: You can see the clutter of the City Dump.
The beautiful promenade lies along the river. What a romantic place to visit!

Room.Name: Inside the South Gate of Midgaard
Room.Description: Two strong stone towers surround a heavy wooden gate set into the city wall, to guard against the goblins that lurk in the southern forests. You can exit the city to the south, if you dare, or walk down the concourse to the east or west.

Exit.Description: The concourse heads east along the inside of the city wall.
You see the southern gate.
The concourse heads west along the inside of the city wall.

Room.Name: Outside the South Gate of Midgaard
Room.Description: You are standing outside the strong wooden gate on the southern walls of Midgaard. Guards eye you suspiciously from the two towers on either side of the gate, as they stand watch to protect the city from the goblins of this forest. The trees and goblins of the Miden'nir are south, the gate back to Migaard lies north.

Exit.Description: You see the southern gate.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are walking along wall road, just north of the west gate of Midgaard. The road continues along the western wall to the north, towards an intersection with a busy Clan street.

Exit.Description: You see an intersection between wall road and a busy Clan street.
The west gate of the city lies south.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: Wall road intersects with a crowded Clan Road here, filled with shops and artisans. The street stretches off to the east, towards the far wall of the city. Wall road continues to the north and south.

Exit.Description: Wall road continues to the north, towards the northwestern corner of the wall.
You see the shops and clan halls of Clan Road.
Wall road continues alongside the western wall, heading towards the west gate.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are walking along wall road, which extends along the inside of the western wall of Midgaard. To the south, you can see an intersection with a crowded Clan street. The northwestern corner of the city wall lies ahead to the north.

Exit.Description: You see the northwestern corner of the city wall.
To the south, wall road intersects with a crowded Clan street.

Room.Name: The Northwest Corner
Room.Description: You are standing beneath the northwestern corner of the city wall, on a turn in wall road. You can head south, towards the west gate, or east, to the north gate.

Exit.Description: Wall road continues along the northern wall of the city.
Wall road continues along the western wall of the city.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: The city walls tower over you as walk down wall road, between the northwestern corner of the wall to the west, and the northern gate of Midgaard to the east.

Exit.Description: Wall road continues to the east, towards the northern gate of Midgaard.
You can see the northwest corner of the city wall to the west.

Room.Name: Inside the North Gate of Midgaard
Room.Description: Two small towers surround a strong wooden gate, connected by a small stone bridge set with murder holes. This gate is not as heavily guarded as the others, as the plains outside are safe to travel. You can leave midgaard to the north, or continues along wall road to the west and east. A teeming clan street is visible to the south, and beyond that the graceful spires of the Temple of Mota, but there is no way to reach them from here.

Exit.Description: The northern plains are visible through the gate.
Wall road continues to the east, alongside the northern wall.
Wall road continues to the west, alongside the northern wall.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are walking along wall road, between the northern gate of the city and the northeastern corner of the city walls. You can see bloodstains on the road... better be on guard for thieves.

Exit.Description: You see the northeastern corner of the city walls.
The northern gate of the city lies east.

Room.Name: The Northeast Corner
Room.Description: Wall road turns the corner here, as you pass by the northeastern edge of the city wall. The north gate lies to your west, and the road south leads to the eastern gate of Midgaard.

Exit.Description: Wall road continues to the south, along the eastern wall of the city.
Wall road continues to the west, along the northern wall of the city.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: Just south of you is an intersection with a crowded clan street. The eastern wall of Midgaard is beside you, and to the north you can see the northeast corner of the city wall.

Exit.Description: You can see the northeast corner of the city wall.
You see an intersection with a crowded street.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: Here, wall road meets up with a busy clan street heading off towards the west, and the far wall of the city. You can smell spices, perfume, freshly cured hide, and other strange scents, all mingle together in one heady aroma. Wall road continues to the north and south.

Exit.Description: Wall road continues to the north, along the eastern wall of the city.
Wall road continues to the south, towards the east gate of Midgaard.
You see a mass of people heading down Clan Road.

Room.Name: Wall Road
Room.Description: You are near the center of wall road, just north of the east gate of the city. To the north, you can see an intersection with a crowded clan street. The guards at the gate eye you suspiciously from afar.

Exit.Description: You see an intersection with a busy clan street.
You see the well-guarded east gate of Midgaard.

Room.Name: Outside the North Gate of Midgaard
Room.Description: You stand outside the north gate of the walled city of Midgaard. A dusty trail is visibile to the north, it stretches around the walls of the city. Further north are the wide expanses of the northern plains, leading to the village of Ofcol. You can return to Midgaard to the south.

Exit.Description: You see the north gate of Midgaard.

Room.Name: On the Concourse
Room.Description: The strong stone walls of Midgaard rise up to the west, keeping evil at bay. The concourse heads towards a bridge to the north, and continues south alongside a beautiful park.

Exit.Description: The concourse continues to the north, along the city wall.
The concourse heads south, passing by a beautiful park.

Room.Name: On the Concourse near the park
Room.Description: You are walking down the Concoruse, along the western wall of Midgaard. To the north, the road passes by a beautiful park, to the south, you can see the southwest corner of the city wall.

Exit.Description: The concourse heads north, passing by a beautiful park.
You can see the southwest corner of the city wall.

Room.Name: On the Concourse at Penny Lane
Room.Description: You are on a road leading around the inner walls of Midgaard. To the north, the concourse heads towards a bridge into northern Midgaard. To the south, you can see an intersection with Elm Street. The quaint paved streets of Penny Lane lie west.

Exit.Description: The concourse continues to the north, towards the east bridge.
The concourse continues south, towards an intersection with Elm Street.
You see Penny Lane.

Room.Name: On the Concourse at Elm Street
Room.Description: The air grows chill as you pass near the Elm Street graveyard. The walls of Midgaard are to the east, and the concourse continues to the north and south. To your west, you see Elm Street at the graveyard entrance.

Exit.Description: The concourse continues to the north, towards an intersection with Penny Lane.
The concourse continues to the south, towards the southeast corner of the wall.
You see Elm Street and the graveyard entrance.

Room.Name: Clan Road
Room.Description: You are standing on the western end of Clan Road. The traffic here is light. This is a quieter section of Midgaard. You can hear the sound of haggling coming from the east. To the north is the Paladin Guild and south is the Anti-Paladin Guild, how ironic.

Exit.Description: Clan Road continues east.
Wall Road is to the west.

Room.Name: Clan Road
Room.Description: You are walking along Clan Road. To the south of you is the money changer. Clan Road continues on to the east and the west and the Assassins guild is to the north.

Exit.Description: Clan Road continues east.
The money changer is to the south.
Clan Road continues west.

Room.Name: Clan Road
Room.Description: The shops on this stretch of Clan road are long-closed and boarded up. Not much traffic passes through this part, as there is nothing to buy. To the north is the necromancer guild and south is the druids haven.

Exit.Description: Clan Road continues to the east.
Clan Road continues to the west.

Room.Name: Clan Road
Room.Description: Noise and light abound on this part of Clan Road. Clan road continues off to the east and west.

Exit.Description: Clan Road continues to the east.
Clan Road continues to the west.

Room.Name: Clan Road
Room.Description: Clan Road seems to widen here slightly, allowing more traffic to travel through the area. To the south is another entrance to the busy pub. This door is also open wide and spilling forth the sounds of happy patrons. Clan Road continues to the east and west.

Exit.Description: Clan Road continues to the east.
A busy pub is to the south.
Clan Road continues to the west.

Room.Name: Clan Road
Room.Description: You are at the eastern end of Clan Road. To the east of you, the tall wall around the city looms up before you and casts its shadow on you. Clan Road continues to the west.

Exit.Description: Wall Road is east of here.
Clan Road continues to the west.

Room.Name: Within the Rift
Room.Description: It is impossible to understand your surroundings. The air ebbs and flows with the essence of magic. The space around you buzzes and explodes in spectrums of color. Your body feels strangly renewed as you stand within this rift in time.

Room.Name: A Money Changer's Room
Room.Description: A few strategically placed lanterns keep this place well-lit in the absence of any windows. The room is surprisingly well appointed with tapestries hanging on the walls. You'd wager your life the moneylender's guards are behind them, as there are none here. The moneylender himself works from behind a large desk, no doubt holding a fortune in gold and silver. A smallish sign hangs on the wall, lettered in common.

Exit.Description: Clan Road is to the north.

ExtraDescription.Description: You think about peeking behind the tapestries, but think better of it.
Give me your coins, and I shall change them for you, taking but 1 in 20 for my fee. --- Otho the Changer

Room.Name: Grebe's Tavern
Room.Description: Dive. That's all you can say about this place; its a dive. You step carefully over the dead and/or drunk sailors on the floor toward the center of the room. There's no decorations on the wall; they've all been ripped down in anger or for use as weapons at one time or another. Looking around, you search vainly for a clean table to sit at, and then give up.

Exit.Description: A dark alley is to the south.

ExtraDescription.Description: Bare, except for the holes.
You find a table that's relatively vomit-free.

Room.Name: Andy's Pub
Room.Description: The busy pub is filled with patrons. People are laughing and singing. A minstrel plays his lute in another part of the pub, and a few people are even dancing. Andy, the pubs owner, wanders around and checks to see that the needs of his customers are met. The bar is to your south. East of you is another section of the pub. You know that there are rooms to be had somewhere around here...

Exit.Description: You see another room in the pub.
The bar is to the south of you.

Room.Name: A Room in the Pub
Room.Description: This part of the pub is filled with dancing and singing. A wandering minstrel is on a chair in a corner with his lute. A busty red headed woman is standing near him and singing a tale of comedic heroism. Drunk men sit laughing at their tables and busy bar maids weave through the crowd with full mugs and horns of ale and mead. Another part of the pub is located to your west. The bar is to the south. A set of steps occupy in a corner of the room. They lead up to the inn section of this prosperous establishment.

Exit.Description: Clan Road is to the north.
The bar is to your south.
Another room in the pub is to your west.
A set of stairs leads up to the reception area.

Room.Name: The Bar
Room.Description: A long mahogany bar is set in the back of the pub. Mugs line a shelf behind the bar. Bottles of strong, nasty looking liquids decorate one of the lower shelves. A large cask rests on a table behind the bar. A strong but friendly-looking bartender stands next to the cask polishing glasses. A couple of the bar maids stand in a corner and throw the most inviting glances your way. A sign is on the wall.

Exit.Description: The pub proper is to the north.

ExtraDescription.Description: The sign says: Don't forget our dinner menu.

Room.Name: The Bar
Room.Description: A long mahogany bar is set in the back of the pub. Mugs line a shelf behind the bar. Bottles of strong, nasty looking liquids decorate one of the lower shelves. A large cask rests on a table behind the bar. A strong but friendly looking bartender stands next to the cask polishing glasses. A couple of the bar maids stand in a corner and throw the most inviting glances your way.

Exit.Description: The pub proper is to the north.

ExtraDescription.Description: The sign says: Don't forget our dinner menu.

Room.Name: The Inn
Room.Description: You are standing upstairs from Andy's Pub at Andy's Inn. A few chairs and a couple of end tables give the room a `homey' atmosphere. A large stone fireplace burns brightly against one wall and warms the room. A large oak desk is nestled in one corner of the room. A small man with wire-framed glasses sits behind the desk working dilligently on his books. He looks up as you enter the room. He looks at you quizzically. He is probably waiting for you to ask him for a room.

Exit.Description: The stairs lead back down to the pub.

Room.Name: A Dark room
Room.Description: The lights in this room are all very dim and kept so on purpose. Incense burns softly from a corner table giving the place a smokey atmosphere. Shadows seem to move against the walls, various Walkers practicing their trade obviously.

Exit.Description: The money changer is to the south.

Room.Name: An Assassins Study
Room.Description: Your eyes adjust slowly to the room and you make out a few of the younger students trying to encompass themselves in darkness. There are bottles of wine and a few plates of bread sitting on the bar. A couple of ornamental chairs are placed in the corners and an ancient looking rug lies on the floor. The Master Assassin stands here, watching you should you fail in your studies.

Room.Name: Entrance to the Necromancer Guild
Room.Description: This alcove is shadowed heavily, the stone seeps some kind of clear fluid that gives it a wet look. The air smells heavily of embalming fluids. To the north is the necromancer guild and the south is clan row.

Room.Name: Necromancer Bar
Room.Description: On the northern wall is a bar fully stocked, vats of embalming fluids are also stored along the east and west walls and a huge shelf runs along the top of the entire western wall, full of reagents and spell compononts.

Room.Name: Necromancer Sanctum
Room.Description: The room is dark and smelly, scattered reagents are on the floor. A huge pentagram is is drawn on the floor for students to use during spells if necessary.

Room.Name: Druids Sanctrum
Room.Description: A soft breeze carreses your face from somewhere but your inside a building. The earth crunches beneath your feet and you feel a sense of peace and harmony with the elements that are so prevalent in this room. The magic inherit in these walls is undeniable. No chairs or seats are seen but a few rocks look well worn from being sat on and a desk made from the wood of a oak tree is in a corner for studying ones spellbooks.

Room.Name: Druids Sanctrum
Room.Description: A bird cage with a beautiful parrot sits in one corner and there is a desk made from pure rock in another with a few quill pens and spellbooks scattered across its top. The floor is earthen and soft to walk in. The guildmaster is barely noticable, as the lower half of his body blends perfectly with the stone wall.

Room.Name: Entrance to the Anti-Paladin
Room.Description: The smell is the first thing to hit you, it smells of death and gore. Sweet to a true Anti-Palaldin nose and horrid to those not of the faith. A small stake is driven into the earthen ground in one corner with a Paladins head mounted on it, as a reminder to all what good brings to oneself. To the north is Clan Row and east is the weapons room.

Room.Name: Torture Chamber
Room.Description: The soft earth floor crushes softly under your feet and a thick haze hangs heavy in the air. Weapons of war are leaning against the wall and hung on hooks for people to spare with. The Master Anti-Paladin stands in a corner with his knife, ready to kill any student who fails his studies. To the west is the entrance hall.

Room.Name: Paladin Guild
Room.Description: The stones of the walls emenate a soft glow that brightens the room ever so softly. Bowls of incense burn in the corner and a small bar is well stocked with sacramental wines and bottles of purified water. To the south is clan road and the Paladin guild proper is to the east.

Room.Name: Paladin Guild
Room.Description: Smoke from the incense lingers in the air and you feel as tho the gods themselves are in this room. Banners bearing the various Paladin Family Crests are hung on the walls with care and a whitebearded guildmaster stands in a corner, praying silently to his god. To the west is the entrance hall of the guild.

NPC.name: wizard
NPC.description: The wizard looks old and senile, and yet he looks like a very powerful wizard. He is equipped with fine clothing, and is wearing many fine rings and bracelets.
NPC.longDescription: A wizard walks around behind the counter, talking to himself.

NPC.name: baker
NPC.description: A fat, nice looking baker. But you can see that he has many scars on his body.
NPC.longDescription: The baker looks at you calmly, wiping flour from his face with one hand.

NPC.name: grocer
NPC.description: A tall grocer, who moves two 200 pounds bag of flour around on his shoulders.
NPC.longDescription: A grocer stands at the counter, with a slightly impatient look on his face.

NPC.name: weaponsmith
NPC.description: A young weaponsmith, who still has lots to learn.
NPC.longDescription: A weaponsmith.

NPC.name: armourer armorer
NPC.description: An old but very strong armourer, he has made more armours in his lifetime than you have ever seen.
NPC.longDescription: An armourer stands here.

NPC.name: thief
NPC.description: Well COUNT your money!
NPC.longDescription: A thief, all dressed in black.

NPC.name: captain
NPC.description: This captain has killed more sharks than you have eaten peas.
NPC.longDescription: A retired captain stands here, selling boats.

NPC.name: sailor
NPC.description: He looks like a strong, fit sailor.
NPC.longDescription: A sailor stands here, waiting to train you.

NPC.name: boy
NPC.description: He is young and close-cropped and looks quite happy.
NPC.longDescription: A pet shop boy is here, humming gently.

NPC.name: jeweller
NPC.description: He is fat and has a content although watchful look on his face.
NPC.longDescription: The jeweller is standing behind the desk.

NPC.name: leather worker
NPC.description: She looks as an honest, hard-working artisan who only just earns enough to keep herself going.
NPC.longDescription: The leather worker is sitting by the table, sewing a leather cap.

NPC.name: Hassan
NPC.description: Big. Very big. Stupid. Very stupid. Hassan, the guardian of the Temple of Mota, towers over you. He's over 12 feet tall, every inch of it muscle. It would be a Bad Thing to commit a crime in his presence.
NPC.longDescription: Hassan is here, waiting to dispense some justice.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectEvil DetectInvis DetectHidden Infrared Haste DarkVision DetectIllusion

NPC.name: healer
NPC.description: Although retired from adventuring, the healer still lends a hand. Type 'heal' to see a listing of spells.
NPC.longDescription: A healer is here, selling spells.

NPC.name: guildmaster master
NPC.description: Even though your guildmaster looks old and tired, you can clearly see the vast amount of knowledge she possesses. She is wearing fine magic clothing, and you notice that she is surrounded by a blue shimmering aura.
NPC.longDescription: Your guildmaster is standing here.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Infrared Sneak DarkVision

NPC.name: guildmaster master
NPC.description: You are in no doubt that this guildmaster is truly close to your god; he has a peaceful, loving look. You notice that he is surrounded by a white aura.
NPC.longDescription: Your guildmaster is standing here.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectEvil DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Sanctuary DarkVision DetectIllusion

NPC.name: guildmaster master
NPC.description: You realize that whenever your guildmaster moves, you fail to notice it: the way of the true thief. She is dressed in poor clothing, having the appearance of a beggar. human
NPC.longDescription: Your guildmaster is standing here.

NPC.name: guildmaster master
NPC.description: This is your master. A short, strong dwarf with bulging muscles. Several scars across his body prove that he was using arms before you were born. He has a calm look on his face.
NPC.longDescription: Your guildmaster is standing here.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Practice Warrior NoPurge AreaAttack

NPC.name: sorcerer
NPC.description: He is an experienced mage who has specialized in the field of Combat Magic. He is here to guard the Mage's Guild and his superior knowledge of offensive as well as defensive spells make him a deadly opponent.
NPC.longDescription: A sorcerer is guarding the entrance.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Mage Warrior NoPurge AreaAttack

NPC.name: templar
NPC.description: He is a specially trained warrior belonging to the military order of the Faith. His duty is to protect the faithful from persecution and infidel attacks and his religious devotion combined with his superior skill makes him a deadly opponent.
NPC.longDescription: A knight templar is guarding the entrance.

NPC.name: assassin
NPC.description: He is a thief who has specialized in killing others as effectively as possible, using all sorts of weapons. His superior knowledge of how and where to use them combined with his extraordinary stealth makes him a deadly opponent.
NPC.longDescription: An assassin is guarding the entrance.

NPC.name: knight
NPC.description: He is an expert warrior who has attained knighthood through countless chivalrous deeds. His duty is to protect the Guild of Swordsmen and his extreme skill combined with his experience in warfare makes him a deadly opponent.
NPC.longDescription: A knight is guarding the entrance.

NPC.name: bartender
NPC.description: A tired looking Bartender who hates trouble in his bar.
NPC.longDescription: A bartender watches you calmly, while he skillfully mixes a drink.

NPC.name: waiter
NPC.description: A tired looking waiter.
NPC.longDescription: A waiter is going around from one place to another.

NPC.name: waiter
NPC.longDescription: A man who in his young days was a famous sorcerer but now leads a quiet, peaceful life as a waiter.

NPC.name: waiter
NPC.longDescription: A waiter who seems to have reached contact with God.

NPC.name: waiter
NPC.longDescription: A waiter who knows where all his customers keep their money.

NPC.name: waiter
NPC.longDescription: A waiter who easily could kill you, and still carry quite a few firebreathers.

NPC.name: filthy
NPC.description: Filthy looks real, ehm, dirty. He likes to keep his costumers happy, but do not mess with him or else he'll get upset.
NPC.longDescription: Filthy is standing here, eager to serve you a special drink.

NPC.name: practice dummy
NPC.longDescription: A practice dummy is here for weapons and ability training.

NPC.name: cityguard guard
NPC.description: A big, strong, helpful, trustworthy guard.
NPC.longDescription: A cityguard stands here.

NPC.name: janitor
NPC.longDescription: A janitor is walking around, cleaning up.

NPC.name: fido dog
NPC.description: Fido is a small dog that has a foul smell and pieces of rotted meat hanging around its teeth.
NPC.longDescription: A beastly fido is here.
NPC.flags: NPC Aggressive StayArea Wimpy NoAlign AreaAttack AssistRace

NPC.name: vagabond
NPC.description: He looks pretty mean.
NPC.longDescription: A vagabond is here, looking for victims.

NPC.name: drunk
NPC.description: A drunk who seems to be too happy, and to carry too much money.
NPC.longDescription: A singing, happy drunk wanders around, singing about Moria.

NPC.name: beggar
NPC.description: The beggar looks like she is fed up with life.
NPC.longDescription: A beggar is here, asking for a few coins.

NPC.name: cat
NPC.description: The alley cat is half starved and more than a little feral.
NPC.longDescription: An alley cat hisses at you.
NPC.flags: NPC Aggressive StayArea Wimpy NoAlign AssistRace

NPC.name: cityguard guard
NPC.description: A big, strong, helpful, trustworthy guard.
NPC.longDescription: A cityguard is here, guarding the gate.

NPC.name: cityguard guard
NPC.description: A big, strong, helpful, trustworthy guard.
NPC.longDescription: A cityguard is here, guarding the gate.

NPC.name: cityguard guard
NPC.description: A big, strong, helpful, trustworthy guard.
NPC.longDescription: A cityguard is here, guarding the mayor.

NPC.name: shopkeeper old man
NPC.description: He looks very dangerous. I wouldn't try to rob him.
NPC.longDescription: An old man eyes you greedily. The old man says, 'Would you like to buy a nice love potion?'
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Cleric Mage NoPurge Shopkeeper

NPC.name: cityguard guard
NPC.description: A big, strong, helpful, trustworthy guard.
NPC.longDescription: A cityguard is here, guarding the gate alertly.

NPC.name: cityguard guard
NPC.description: A big, strong, helpful, trustworthy guard.
NPC.longDescription: A cityguard is here, guarding the gate. He is half asleep.

NPC.name: kitten cat pet
NPC.description: The kitten looks like a cute, little, fierce fighter.
NPC.longDescription: A small loyal kitten is here.

NPC.name: puppy dog pet
NPC.description: The puppy looks like a cute, little, fierce fighter.
NPC.longDescription: A small loyal puppy is here.

NPC.name: beagle dog pet
NPC.description: The beagle looks like a fierce fighter.
NPC.longDescription: A small, quick, loyal beagle is here.

NPC.name: rottweiler dog pet
NPC.description: The rottweiler looks like a strong, fierce fighter.
NPC.longDescription: A large, loyal rottweiler is here.

NPC.name: wolf pet
NPC.description: The wolf looks like a strong, fearless fighter.
NPC.longDescription: A large, trained wolf is here.

NPC.name: eagle bird pet
NPC.description: The eagle looks like a strong fierce fighter.
NPC.longDescription: A loyal eagle circles overhead.

NPC.name: lion pet
NPC.description: The great lion looks very fierce.
NPC.longDescription: A large, faithful lion is here.

NPC.name: tiger pet
NPC.description: The large, striped tiger looks like a savage fighter.
NPC.longDescription: A great, loyal tiger is here.

NPC.name: maid
NPC.description: She is very beautiful with golden hair, and deep blue eyes. A good reason for coming here more often.
NPC.longDescription: The maid is waiting for your order.

NPC.name: sexton
NPC.description: The sexton looks like he is relaxing after another grave-digging job.
NPC.longDescription: A sexton is sitting here, drinking hot tea.

NPC.name: swan
NPC.description: The white swan is very elegant.
NPC.longDescription: A swan is swimming around in the pond.

NPC.name: duckling
NPC.description: The duckling is adorable, it looks most of all like a tiny furball.
NPC.longDescription: A duckling is swimming around in the pond.

NPC.name: sparrow
NPC.description: The sparrow looks like it is enjoying life.
NPC.longDescription: A sparrow is flapping around on the ground.

NPC.name: duck
NPC.description: The duck is quite fat. It looks like it is enjoying life.
NPC.longDescription: A duck is here, quacking happily.

NPC.name: captain
NPC.description: A big, strong, angry captain.
NPC.longDescription: The captain of the guard is looking very upset.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Scavenger Aggressive Warrior AssistVnum

NPC.name: cityguard guard
NPC.description: A big, strong, angry guard.
NPC.longDescription: A cityguard stands here, looking very upset.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Scavenger Aggressive Warrior AssistVnum

NPC.name: secretary
NPC.description: She looks very busy. The Secretary says 'Sorry, but the Mayor is extremely busy today'. The Secretary says 'Please sit down and have a seat in the meantime'.
NPC.longDescription: A secretary is sitting at the desk.

NPC.name: mayor
NPC.description: He is a stocky, middle-aged man with thin, grey hair.
NPC.longDescription: The mayor is here. He shakes your hand.

NPC.name: crier
NPC.description: He is very good at his job - completely dissolved in tears.
NPC.longDescription: The town crier is here, weeping quietly.

NPC.name: esme waitress
NPC.description: Esme brushes a lock of dark hair away from her wire-rimmed glasess and smiles warmly at you.
NPC.longDescription: Esme the waitress hums to herself and wonders what you'd like to order.

NPC.name: Melancholy
NPC.description: Ragged brown hair frames a ghostly, pale face. Puffy eyelids surround two sky blue, haunting eyes. An old, brown robe is wrapped around her frail frame. She looks up from her pile of papers and maps and looks inquiringly at you, smiling faintly.
NPC.longDescription: Melancholy is here, digging through a pile of scrolls, papers, and maps.

NPC.name: lister green tree snake
NPC.description: This is Melancholy's pet tree snake, Lister. Something seems odd about his jaw, almost as if he were smiling at you. He's quite friendly, but don't get him drunk.
NPC.longDescription: A green tree snake is sitting here on a pile of books.

NPC.name: otho money changer moneychanger
NPC.description: Otho is grotesquely fat man dressed in rich clothes. Apparently the money changing business pays quite well in this busy city, or possibly the rumors of his fencing services are true...
NPC.longDescription: Otho the Money Changer sits behind his desk, waiting for your coins.

NPC.name: thief
NPC.description: Well COUNT your money!
NPC.longDescription: A thief, all dressed in black.

NPC.name: guildmaster necromancer
NPC.description: Even though your guildmaster looks old and tired, you can clearly see the vast amount of knowledge she possesses. She is wearing fine magic clothing, and you notice that she is surrounded by a blue shimmering aura. The guildmaster is in perfect condition.
NPC.longDescription: Your guildmaster stands here.

NPC.name: guildmaster druid
NPC.description: Dressed in a long green robe made of wool, this elementalist is intent on teaching and learning. He stands sturdy, summoning the fierce winds and the earth to serve him.
NPC.longDescription: Your guildmaster stands here.

NPC.name: guildmaster deathknight
NPC.description: Dressed in blackened armor, your guildmaster glares at you evilly hoping for a fight. But, if you want to learn the dark ways, he'll teach you. His hands and armor are cacked with the blood of innocents. And he appears to be wearing a necklace of human fingers.
NPC.longDescription: Your guildmaster is here, offering a sacrifice to the Dark Gods.

NPC.name: guildmaster paladin
NPC.description: This is your master. A short, strong dwarf with bulging muscles. Several scars across his body prove that he was using arms before you were born. He has a calm look on his face.
NPC.longDescription: Your guildmaster is standing here.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Sanctuary Infrared ProtectionEvil DetectIllusion

NPC.name: guildmaster assassin
NPC.description: Dressed in a black robes assassin master ready for teach you how hiding and do a deadly strikes to your opponent.
NPC.longDescription: Your guildmaster stands here.

NPC.name: seeker infinity
NPC.description: He looks back at you slowly and then goes back to his meditations.
NPC.longDescription: A Seeker of Infinity is here watching over his Lords shrine.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Sanctuary ProtectionEvil ProtectionGood Flying PassDoor DetectIllusion

NPC.name: Newbie creator man stout
NPC.longDescription: A Small Stout Man Creating Newbies Walks Between The Vats Here

NPC.name: A newbie dude
NPC.longDescription: A newbie dude helper is here.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel NoTrack Cleric NoPurge Healer

NPC.name: guildmaster
NPC.longDescription: Your guildmaster stands here.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Practice NoTrack Cleric NoPurge Gain

NPC.name: trainer
NPC.longDescription: The trainer stands ready to train you.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Gain NoTrack Mage Warrior NoPurge

NPC.name: newbie musician
NPC.longDescription: A newbie musician is here playing a recorder.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea NoTrack NoPurge Shopkeeper
